page.title: 17PIG SALTING TABLE
page.content: We went to visit{Coppice Farm.Mr {Cook}showed us his{pig salting table, which was in his pantry. The pig salting table is a{large {sandstone slab}about two and a half metres long and a metre wide.Around the edge is a curved groove which is used as a drain. A square of pork was on the slab and salt rubbed into it.The salt mixed with the juice of the meat and ran out as brine into the grooves and drained away.This was called{curing}the pig.They had to do that because they did not have refrigerators and the meat would have gone off. When they came to a month without an "R" in it no pigs were killed because it was to hot.
